<div class="c-pageProductReviews_row g-outer-spacing-bottom-xxlarge"><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 7 out of 10" aria-label="User score 7 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">7</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/skogsgurka/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="skogsgurka">
    skogsgurka
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 28, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Tried this game because of hype, had no experience with DnD or similar RPG’s. And for a guy like me there was way too little tutorial. I was still figuring out basic combat mechanics 30 h in, and spent a lot of time googling the list of 40 abilities presented every time you level up. But really cool how side quests and main story seemlessly blend. Stuff that seem random at first turn out to be hugely significant to the plot. Overall I had a cozy time planning combat and experiencing the sort of 80’s fantasy art style. There’s been a lot of praise for how big the game is, but I feel most of my time was spent in menus, wish it was story progression instead. The game’s also been praised for roll playing possibilities, but I think I would’ve needed a more anonymous main character without pre determined face reactions etc to get into it. Lastly, big fights are usually puzzle based and I had fun with that, but there was a lot of trial and error which was a slog because of long loading times. I was under the impression you could solve the puzzles based on your characters unique skillset, but most of the time there’s a set way you should be doing things. It’s probably different for more experienced DnD players who can break the game a bit to progress, but with lacking knowledge that was hard to do intuitively.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

The controls use clunky radials with not enough space for a character's skills meaning you end up with a cluttered mess which is awkward to navigate and makes the game very frustrating. Ilość nieudanych ruchów, ciosów, zaklęć, podobnie jak mnogość bugów, glitchy i niedoróbek jest ekstremalnie **** staje się festiwalem wielokrotnego wczytywania save'ów, bo znów coś poszło nie tak. Jedyne punkty jakie przyznaję są za fabułę i styl, gdyż te są na najwyższym poziomie.Menu jest kompletnie zawalone - niefunkcjonalne, nieresponsywne, co dziwi, bo w serii Divinity było pod tym względem dobrze, jak na konsolę.     Sep 5, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>simplesmente o melhor jogo que eu já joguei. Jogo que tem sua história baseado no rpg D&amp;D onde tudo é recompensador, seja sua historia onde vc pode moldar relacionamento de acordo com sua personalidade e a do participante da "party" com relacionamentos bem construídos. Sua exploração não deixa a desejar onde não há vontade de deixar de explorar por que a todo momento você é recompensado seja com pontos de afeto ou um novo sett de armaduras ou espadas diferentes que de fato irão mudar sua gameplay deixando ela mais "fácil" mesmo sendo um jogo desafiador. Você pode ser o que o jogo te disponibiliza sendo um orc guerreiro e mago ou outras variações. Seus gráficos que podem não ser um primor para um jogo desse estilo esta muito bonito mas poderiam caprichar na optimização já que o jogo pode ser um pouco travado dependendo da situação. Seu combate simplesmente é perfeito e não cansa em momento nenhum pelo fato de infinitas variações e possibilidades, se o combate for uma preocupação sua, deveria ignora-la pois é um combate perfeito e balanceado. O jogo conta com suas em media 70 horas ou 100 mas por incrível que pareça ela te vicia de um jeito que você nunca viu onde nenhum momento vc se sente cansado ou coisa do tipo Simplesmente uma das maiores obras de artes que uma empresa já fez ressuscitando o gênero mais uma vez e dessa vez ganhando um premio gigante como o goty simplesmente uma das maiores obras de artes de todos os tempos, lê apresento Baldurs Gate 3.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>J'étais de base un peu réticente, pour avoir joué aux baldur's gate au clavier souris sans tour à tour (à l'ancienne), connaissant le studio Larian (Divinity) j'avais peur.
Puis alors là quelle claque !!! 
Ils ont fait un travail de dingue !
Déjà ils ont respecté les fans de Baldur's Gate, on sent la patte Larian et la patte Baldur's Gate. 
Niveau possibilité c'est juste incroyable tout ce que l'on peut faire, les personnages mis à notre disposition sont hyper sympas, on apprend leur histoire au fur et à mesure (de belles histoires bien écrites).
Les musiques pouah je les adore, elles sont mémorables ! Dont une, vous vous arrêtez de jouer pour l'écouter, tellement qu'elle est incroyable avec le combat que vous venez de lancer.
Les fins : plusieurs en fonction de vos choix, ce qui est toujours plaisant ! 
Goty largement mérité !</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    VOIIIXI
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jul 19, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>One of the worst and most boring games I've ever played.I don't know anything about tabletop games or dungeons and dragons and I never liked turn based games. The only reason I wanted to play this game was from hearing about it so much, so much praise, and so many awards and people talking about it, how it's called one of the best games ever and how it's 96 rated on metacritic. I also played hundreds of games and I love any game that gives you freedom of choice and multiple approaches and consequences to your actions and different endings...I've played about 3 hours Baldur's Gate 3 and then I uninstalled. I'll explain why I think it's one of the worst games I've played:1- The Combat: This is the main and biggest reason why I absolutely hated the game, so you walk around freely in the game like any rpg and encounter quests and characters and chests and whatnot, but then whenever you encounter enemies the entire world literally pauses around you and it becomes a 1999 tabletop game that some nerdy kids in some basement play, it actually turns into Raid Shadow Legends lmao, it's actually hilarious that so many people like it, I guess stupidity knows no limits when it comes to the video game industry. And so it basically kills any momentum and the combat becomes this dice game where you click on an enemy and then your character attacks them and it either misses or hits, so you're not playing the game using your skills or your moves, it's just a dice game. This game is where I vowed to never ever buy or download games based on reputation and reviews, I have to watch a long playthrough in order to decide to get it or not.2- Everything All At Once: One of the other reasons why I uninstalled the game and stopped playing is because of how much convoluted stuff is in the game from the very start, like 30 different attacks or items in one character, this with 2 turns and it turns this to that for 10 turns and this attack isn't actually an attack and this move makes you hide and that move is a flame that heals and that move is some spell that turns enemies into jelly or makes them scared... It's just soooo much that I went "what the f**k is going in, what's all of this s**t?!". I know some games doesn't hold your hand but this is just a horrible terrible game that basically excepts you to be a Baldur's Gate player for 20 years and also have played the tabletop games, it's insanely dreadful for new players and I'm actually shocked that so many people new to the game with the IQ of 2 managed to like the game so much.3- The Story From The Start Is Not Interesting: The game starts with tentacle monsters and dragons and multiple race creatures and different worlds and so many things happening at once that I just literally lost interest from the start. The beginning **** or a in my opinion is the most important part to me, If from the start you're bored and uninteresting because of how much stuff is happening it's a bad game/movie. Games should have a clear beginning where you build up to things and slowly learn what this and that is, this game feels like you're dropped in the third act **** where you're already unlocked it all and so much story already happened, it doesn't feel like a new game that you start.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Also the dialogues are very detailed and important for the rest of your playthrough. There are so many options that one campaign might be enough and you will probably play the game with the Dark Urge origin character that offers an additionnal plot twist and a deep backstory.   </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The PR campaign and press reviews are way above actual reality. It is an overall good game which builds on the current D&amp;D ruleset and the legacy of the previous Baldur's Gate title and general Bioware RPGs. The interface is clunky, and the combat and gameplay is sometimes too. The character faces and movements are not top notch. Woke elements are ruining the character creation to the point of being unbearable. 5 or 7 face options are given but for some reason the same amount of dangling genitalia was deemed more important. Writing of characters is sometimes very shallow, with the language depth of a pre-teen (Barbarian). Multiplayer is very enjoyable though again, junky in terms of dialogue. Totally worth playing, but nowhere close in terms of quality to what the press PR pushes it to be.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 6 out of 10" aria-label="User score 6 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">6</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Vega8ond/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Vega8ond">
    Vega8ond
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    May 19, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is nothing more than Neverwinter Nights with updated graphics.  I don't understand how this game got so many great reviews.  It is a simple formulaic turn-based RPG that hasn't added much from previous installments. No way is this game of the year or even close. It is not a bad game, but it isn't spectacular either. 

The "mature" aspect of this game and the lobby behind it is what is giving this game the hype. I'm not going to trust any more game review sites going forward.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/YannySp101/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="YannySp101">
    YannySp101
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    May 15, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I've never played Dungeons &amp; Dragons, Baldur's Gate or any CRPG ever in my life, but I'm just gonna say it straight away; this game is **** nuts! From the nearly endless amount of gameplay options, to the absolute freedom of choice, constant decisions that matter and different outcomes, unparalleled depth, variety and content, Baldur's Gate 3 is without a doubt, the ultimate RPG of all time, hands down.
The story of the game, however, is divided into 3 Acts.
Act 1 is probably the best and most well-designed videogame experience I've ever had, 40 hours worth of content.
Act 2 is half the lenght of the other 2 acts and more linear, but it's a refreshing change of pace and a great continuation of the first act.
Act 3 is the culmination of the entire story and it's very similar to the first act, albeit slightly less polished, but it's incredible nonetheless.
Overall, the story is very interesting and well-written, although it relies heavily on side-stories like many other RPGs.
The characters are some of the best I've seen in an RPG, period.
The visuals and the music are amazing as well, even though the visuals didn't particularly impress me.
Unfortunately, the game suffers from some minor technical issues at times, like pop-ins and input lag, but it's not a big deal at all.

Pros:
+ Excellent gameplay
+ RPG elements and depth
+ Variety and content
+ Intriguing story
+ Wonderful characters
+ Beautiful music and visuals

Cons:
- Minor technical issues

Narrative: 9/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Content: 10/10
Characters: 10/10
Music: 9/10
Graphics/Audio: 9/10

Final Rating: 10/10
- Masterpiece -
At the end of the day, I'm thankful at Larian Studios for dedicating mind and soul to create such a passionately crafted work of art in every single way. The developers really cared about this game and it shows; Baldur's Gate 3 is the kind of videogame other studios should strive to make, and it also manage to do the impossible; I can't even believe that I'm saying this but it might even be my new favorite videogame of all time at this point.

Do I recommend it?:
Must-play for RPG fans and highly recommended for everyone else too.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

I spent 411 hours cumulative according to my PS5, which is by far the most amount of time I've spent in any single-player game.

There's something just a bit off about the experience that keeps it from the 10/10 which is Divinity: Original Sin 2.  The story beats,especially the emotional parts, don't land as well.  There's too much cringy sex stuff and weird romances with almost everyone in the game wanting to jump your bones it seems like.  I wish this genre of RPGs would do away with romances tbh.

Mi dispiace solo dover lasciare il mio ****... troppo bello!</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Optimization in baldurs gate is very lame, but it's forgivable for a game like this one</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/angelknives/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="angelknives">
    angelknives
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 26, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Fun as it is to be a contrarian, I can't help but agree with the universal praise this game is getting. It's been a long time since an RPG scratched all my itches and trust me, I've been looking.

The funnest part with any RPG for me is experimenting with the story and choices you get, and that experimentation is (almost) always rewarded in BG3. It's the reason I've put an obscene amount of time in this game. Well, that and the characters. 
The companions especially feel more alive than in most RPGs out there. (Shown by how passionately some people love or hate them.) But there are also plenty of smaller characters that are just as interesting.

This game quickly became my favourite of all time, and I don't see any other surpassing it any time soon.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/themikeyg/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="themikeyg">
    themikeyg
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 26, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Disappointing. I so badly want to like this game: I love D&amp;D, I love RPGs where your choices have big impacts, I love games where your party has growth. But this game is a huge miss. I've reached the end of the game and I've yet to play for an hour without experiencing a bug that was at best extremely frustrating and at worst (and frequently) game breaking. The pacing is horrible. There's an immediate sense of urgency in the main quest but you're also given a huge amount of side quests immediately, some of which are time sensitive. Side treks linger on for far longer than feels natural. And then, in Act2, the game suddenly becomes incredibly linear with only two point of significant interest. It feels rushed, feels sloppy, feels like it was in "early access" for too **** writing is boring. It's as if someone read a few D&amp;D rule books and said "Yes I want to cram all of this in here."The companions are uninspired and templated. Here is all origin companions: "I was very powerful, but the bug in my head has me at level 1. I am a slave to XYZ, my quest is to secure my freedom from them. Along the way you can make the binary choice of me being a good guy or a bad guy."The game gives you access to all the creative tools of D&amp;D, but punishes out of the box solutions and forces you into a linear or binary choice which is sometimes not even hinted at. For example (keeping it vague for spoilers), there was an encounter where an NPC was trapped on a cart full of explosive oil with a flammable trail of liquid leading to him and some hostile NPCs set the liquid on fire. I threw water at the fire around the cart, it exploded and he died. Reload. I run up and help/talk to him, it exploded and he died. Reload. I quickly kill all enemies in one round, it exploded and he died. Reload. I throw water on the flammable liquid trail before the encounter starts. Fire doesn't reach him! ...until the second round where the other half of the trail randomly catches fire with no interaction from any characters. Reload. I use a telekinesis spell to move the captive NPC to safety, he randomly teleports back to the location he was in but now he's prone and hostile. Reload. Googled a solution. Apparently you have to shoot the chair he's sitting on? Are you serious? Nothing ever indicated that solution, and any of the previous solutions should have worked, but this game won't allow creative thinking. There are numerous examples of instances where you're able to withhold info from NPCs, but then they suddenly have the info as if you told them anyway because the story can't continue if they don't know it. Don't give me the option to make these choices if you don't actually have a continuation for them. Terrible planning. Near infinite glitches, bugs, and visual clipping **** UI/UX leaves a lot to be desired. Sorting your inventory is mess. Tutorial pop ups appear and cover up important info but can't be dismissed until you leave the current screen you're trying to interact with. Objective indicators often lead you in the wrong direction if you enter another area. Dye color names are sometimes misleading. Random NPCs will prevent you from looting something that should be of no concern to them or should be rightfully yours to access. The learning curve for the sloppy combat mechanics is frustrating. Dashing really confuses the games logic often throwing a "can't reach this target" when you in fact can, and you just need to select the area next to it first.This game is truly a mess and undeserving of the praise it receives. A real shame because it could have been a 10/10 if Larian actually put the effort into it, but I suppose the bar for GOTY is low these days and easy profit is tempting. Seriously a shame.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 7 out of 10" aria-label="User score 7 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">7</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Rixalot/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Rixalot">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Graphics, story, characters, game play, world design are all great. Spend too much time in that chest for the game to be freezing on me every other time I'm trying to do something.  Too bad because I was enjoying the game otherwise.  Big improvement over Divinity Sin 2 on Switch.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Game is pretty good,most of the bug have been ironed out now,so I had a smooth experience on ps5,except of some minor issues.Act1  reminded of DOS2 a bit,which I wasn't a big fan of,but reaching Act2 I was properly hooked.Truth be told,I was expecting a more modern battle system,real time with pause would be great like BG2 or Dragon Age Origins,although it's working nice as it is,but it's nothing groundbreaking.Story is good and characters are great,except the fact that everyone for some reason want to f@@k me,even when I don't pursue the issue.I mean yes,I know,my necromancer is handsome but **** ruins the sense of companionship.Well,it's hard to ignore the hard work making this game,the scope and the almost endless possibilities approaching each situation.Much deserved goty.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/bskierys/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="bskierys">
    bskierys
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Feb 25, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Best game I played in years. The amount of freedom of options is impressive and at the same time it flows so natural that it is not overwhelming. The combat and leveling system is simple yet compelling. As a veteran D&amp;D dungeon master, it reminded it how fun can turn-based combat be (it feels different from DM perspective). of course it is not ideal, but it has so much freedom, that even with it's flaws, you can bypass the things that you don't like.

Pros: 
+ Freedom to craft your story. Enough story structure to make it interesting, and enough choices to decide how do you want to play. I've spent 170 hours in this game and every time I talk to someone I find out they had different interactions or discovered something I missed.
+ Story. It scratches a lot of the Forgotten Realms, has a lot of twists, some clickes and interesting characters. It both have fully developed characters (like companions, whose personal stories are amazing), and one-dimensional (like Raphael, who is the best villains I had opportunity to kill in years. He is full of cliches, and I love it).
+ Music, Visuals and voice acting. Simply amazing.
+ Engaging combat and leveling up. It's opinion. The systems were complex enough to be engaging but simple so I didn't loose track what are my abilities up to level 10 (the last two levels I was a little lost, but hitting things as a barbarian stayed engaging).
+ Very close to real D&amp;D. As a long-time player, I can relate. Especially to situations when we tried had a plan, and something went awful but we decided to roll with it. I got arrested twice and had to escape, I had Gale playing horribly on violin to distract giant eagles while Astarion tries to sneak and gots entangled in vines. Pure comedy.

Cons:
- Inventory management. I played on console and sometimes we had (I played with my wife in local co-op) a 2-hour gaming session of just shopping. It was painful.
- No ability to change character during dialog. When someone approached us, It was always my character who was talking. And I played dumb barbarian. Sometimes it was funny, but sometimes I wish I could have a choice.
- Some major consequences were affected by a dice roll. It's fun to have some small consequences based on your poor dice roll, but when something bad happens, I'd rather have some choice and not dice. I didn't want to savescum, but because of that we did it twice.
- Local co-op was better in Divinity Original Sin 2. Split screen in combat is not ideal. Same for joined initiative where we ruined our own plans by acting at the same time.
- Host of the game in multiplayer has more attention. All the people want to talk to them. It's less engaging for other players.
- Bugs. I played from the day 1 on the PS5. Most of the major ones were fixed before we reached the end, but thera are still some of them. Feel warned.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    rybkinrolla
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Feb 20, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I have no idea why this game is rated so high. At least on PS5 it's really bad. And yes, I played D&amp;D a lot when I was a student, so I understand the thing with dices and everything else. I've registered here specifically to share my opinion about this game.

1.  They didn't make even an in-game calculator, so when you're trading you should count by yourself the difference in gold.
2. The thing that PS5 keyboard pops up after you choose to enter numbers makes me crazy.
3. Those "circles" with spells and abilities are inconvenient, especially because you can't delete some of them even if they are empty.
4. When you drop your weapons after the enemy's ability, you need to set up the "circles" again, because the game doesn't save where the ability was before. That's annoying.
5. I played the game in January 2024, and there are still plenty of bugs.
With major ones, like I was in a tower at the start of Act 3, and couldn't jump off on a lower level because the camera didn't allow me to pick the needed angle. Or when the cursor was stuck to the character up to 5-7 seconds after I picked the ability, that happened to me 1 out of 25-30 times, so pretty often considering that the game is based on this mechanic. And many more bugs including visual ones.
6. The major storyline starts with nothing and ends with nothing.

So, because this game gives you many opportunities to choose and those choices impact the progress doesn't make it SO GOOD like many described.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Feb 19, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Un juego que sorprendió, una historia larga y profunda con una jugabilidad inmejorable</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 5 out of 10" aria-label="User score 5 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">5</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/foobar42/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="foobar42">
    foobar42
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Feb 19, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>BG3 is a very mixed bag and since so many reviews seem to intentionally overlook the bad parts I feel the need to highlight them. A lot has been said about the positive aspects like the epic story, length, characters and freedom of choice already.
But what made me take a lengthy break after about 140 hours into act 3:
* there are really many technical issues on the PS5. Every conversation begings with the characters lacking about 40% of their textures which is absolutely immersion breaking for me and some bugs make it necessary to restart the game
* everybody is super horny which feels forced and sometimes results in outright second hand embarrassment
* there really is an unprecedented freemdom of choice but there were quite a few times were character reactions seemed totally out of place or did not appropriately consider the things that took place
* inventory management is horrible and I can't see how it can be explained with realism or truthfulness to DnD mechanics when there are some convenience functions
So yeah, I really like the game and I hope many developers try to replicate the good parts but it has some serious problems and I don't feel that reviewers adequately pointed them out.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Combat, in particular, is a major letdown. While previous entries in the series offered engaging real-time battles that required quick thinking and strategic planning, Baldur's Gate 3 opts for a turn-based system that feels sluggish and cumbersome. The pacing of combat encounters is often tedious, with little room for improvisation or creativity. This shift away from real-time action robs the game of the excitement and intensity that defined its predecessors.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>While a bit of a slow burn kind of game, Baldur's Gate 3 is a game that is replayable multiple times over, and is a faithful love letter to D&amp;D fans. The character creator is very deep. The characters are very dynamic with how they develop. The story is very intricately written, full of hidden lore that helps add to the experience. Combat seems simple at first, but has more depth than it lets on. A worthy winner for game of the year, and considering Larian is an underdog studio, one that doesn't nickel and dime players, and one that is working very hard to fix any issues that arises, they are to be commended for their efforts with making an experience players will remember for years to come.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 31, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Quite simply, one of the best games ever made. The level of attention to detail from Larian is astounding. I've never been a CRPG fan, tried to get into Divinity OS 2 many times but never got out of fort Joy. BG3 however has pulled me in and kept me, even got me dabbling in D&amp;D! 
The characters, music, world design, narration, voice acting, ambient sounds, d&amp;d systems are all sublime, and Larian have really thought of everything. 
If you think 'hm, i wonder if this would work' - chances are, it will. No other game besides tabletop D&amp;D gives you this level of freedom while still managing to tell you a cohesive and interesting story, intertwined with some fascinating individual character storylines. 
As for combat, this was my biggest worry going in, as I have never got on well with turn-based combat, but BG3 makes it more accessible than ever. It will take a bit of getting used to, a bit of trial and error and no doubt some save-scumming, but once it clicks... it's brilliant. 
I will be playing this game for years, and i'm so happy I gave it a shot. Larian are THE studio to watch now. They're showing the rest of the industry how it's done.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

It has transformed my preferences, showcasing a level of depth in choices, dialogues, and decisions that I had never encountered before. With over 100 hours invested in this masterpiece, I can confidently say that I've never witnessed anything comparable. The precision of the choices presented is awe-inspiring, leaving me in a state of perpetual astonishment. I find myself reluctant for the game to conclude, dreading the return to a world saturated with uninspiring titles like Diablo 4 and Ubisoft games, which pale in comparison.Larian, thank you. My attachment to this game is profound, and I intend to carry it with me beyond the realms of gaming. Elden Ring and BG3 stand as the transformative pillars in my gaming journey. In short, words fall short to express my gratitude for the experience you've bestowed upon ****'ve irreversibly influenced the gaming industry, setting a standard that rejects mediocre and hollow creations.       PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/krikaoli/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="krikaoli">
    krikaoli
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 27, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I changed my review, from 6 to 9. I think I had higher expectations than the game could offer... Before delving into the review, it's important for me to clarify that I am a former player of traditional tabletop RPGs like Dungeons and Dragons and Vampire: The Masquerade. With that said, 

Positive: Incredible story, rich characters, a lot of fun and a unique experience. It is impossible not to love after sometime playing, if you don't give up in the first hours.

Negative: I'd like to caution those considering purchasing Baldur's Gate 3 that the game has some flaws that significantly impede the overall gameplay experience. One of them is the lack of a simpler and more dynamic combat system, and another critical point is the absence of information regarding the required level for entering specific areas of the map and dungeons. This latter issue often results in wasting time, experiencing party wipeouts, and being forced to load from a much earlier **** the positive side, the game does boast a rich story, but it could benefit from being more intuitively designed. The game's progression feels somewhat cumbersome, and there is room for improvement in terms of gameplay mechanics. In few words, the game is a little complex for beginners, and maybe the interface could be more friendly.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>What a gem! 
I dont usually play turn based games, but this one is just too perfect from start to finish! 
And to think many many hours have also gone to try interactions (battles and dialogue) all over again, so I can get a better outcome, and I love it!

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Shockscape/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Shockscape">
    Shockscape
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 25, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I hated this game when I first played it because I didn’t have a clue where I was going or what I needed to do. However, after I got familiarized with the game, did some side content and leveled up my characters, I had a lot of fun. The amount of choice u have in this game is insane - you can be a good person (like I did) or not, perhaps even choosing the Dark Urge. Combat can be a little confusing at the start because there isn’t really a tutorial. The game doesn’t say ‘this is this’ etc, but the way the game makes D and D so much more simpler means there’s not much to get confused with here, except maybe choosing abilities and classes. My only other issue with combat is that it can be really really hard. Initially I didn’t do loads of side content, only a necessary amount to get me past a fight I was struggling with. But this game is divided into acts, and that means that once u enter a new large area, the only way to go back to where u were before is loading an older save, and if u don’t wanna do that because u have progressed the game quite a lot since that point then ur screwed and all u can do is turn the difficulty down. That just feels like a huge oversight for me. Also with certain quests I had to rely on YouTube a fair bit to know what to do as it’s a little cryptic at times. However apart from these points, everything else is pretty much perfect. The combat is fun. The acting is amazing. The characters are mostly interesting. Choosing your path as you progress is something I wish more games did, and it’s done so well here. It deserved GOTY because it did so many things great that other games don’t and felt like a completely new experience. You just have to be patient and give this game a try for yourself. Too many games nowadays just shove microtransactions in your face, but not BG3. You get what you paid for, and you never get asked ‘buy the latest skin for only £60’ like Overwatch 2 or Call of Duty. Overall a great experience that should show other developers that the audience doesn’t want a digital shopping simulator with a mediocre, half baked game on the side. You should try BG3 but not EVERYONE is gonna like it because it’s a turn-based game. However, it might just surprise you, like it surprised me.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Great story, nice graphics, but the combat is sloooooowww. Add to that, that the chance of missing a hit doesn't represent the percentages (I've experienced that you can easily miss at 99% hit chance, 3 times in a row), which doesn't make the combat fun or tactical. There are way better alternatives than random (incorrect) results after the role of the dice. I often reload out of frustration, which takes rediculously long on top of that. Furthermore, I found out that I've missed several quests since for some quests, there are no quest indicators on the map, while the quest menu is an unorganized mess (at least on the ps5). Actually, the whole menu structure is quite unorganized and rather illogical. Also,why does it have so many different spells, doing more or less the same, not even providing a particular and clear tactical advantage in battle, as well as limited spell slots and a limited spellbook? More focus would be better (Less is more).</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Not typically my kind of game considering the turn-based combat and DnD atmosphere but wow was I blown away! You can tell the developers really cared about the finished product and man did they deliver. Easy to pick up, difficult to master with a lot going on with party management/stats/lore etc. etc. but I felt the game did a good job of not overwhelming the player at the beginning and easing into things. I did get Skyrim syndrome initially, restarting a few times after 5-10 hr runs before I was satisfied with a character I had created. Game has an insane amount of replay value as you can have completely different experiences each playthru considering the character you made and the choices and actions you decide to take throughout.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/wonkykathy/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="wonkykathy">
    wonkykathy
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 19, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Best RPG I’ve played, second place goes to Mass Effect. Those are the only two games I’ve finished and have multiple play throughs of. It’s a no brainer if you’re a fan of RPGs and life changing works of art.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

    emberedfury
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 19, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>How the hell did this buggy PoS win Game of the Year? And also win COMMUNITY SUPPORT!? After several huge patches that make this game take over 100 Gb of storage space, there are still a plethora of bugs that lock you out of content. It was a really slimy tactic for Larian to only allow you to play Act 1 during early access and give the false sense of a completed and functioning game. I have dumped over 200 hours into this game, most of which creating new characters and playing through Act 1 several times until I found the right character to see the story through. However, Act 2 and beyond are buggy messes that lock you out of content you paid full price for. The best metaphor I can think of to describe this is that you take a turd, polish it, spray with cologne, wrap it in gold, so it loses the same of a turd, but when you open it you are still left with a pile of SH**. 

Never buying another game from Larian so I can waste time more time on something so buggy it **** any fun or potential it had.

So TLDR if you are fine with paying full price for the shiny wrapper of a turd, go ahead and throw your money on this dumpster fire.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    GamergodsFail
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 16, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate III is, simply put, one of the absolute greatest role playing experiences ever come to fruition. Although there have briefly been a couple rough updates that left certain parts of it in a bad state, a great community and a studio who listens to feedback constantly come together to fix whatever is wrong. Very few occurances in the timeline of recent gaming history do we see genre-defining games that set the bar and hold a new gold standard. 

With compelling and immersive storytelling, choices that change the course of whole playthroughs, near endless amount of replayability and a mindblowing amount of gameplay options and combat mechanics to progress through the game with, offering a staggering amount of ways to play how you want to play, Baldur's Gate III truly belongs on the pantheon of all time greats. From this point on, every CRPG that hits the market will have some very large shoes to fill. This is the 2023 Game of the Year.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>BG3 is a special game. I initially didn’t love the combat because it was the first game with this type of combat that I had played. As I progressed through the game it became for fun. I also watched some videos on YouTube on how to properly build my character. This game its probably the best game when it comes to role playing in the fantasy genre. I have many other build ideas. I am writing this review after finishing the game. I did every quest I came across, but I’m sure I missed some things. Regardless my first play through on normal difficulty was at about 98 hours. It’s a long game, but if you enjoy RPGs it’s absolutely worth the money. The reviews for this game are absolutely warranted. It isn’t for everyone, mostly because of the combat, but once you figure it out it’s an amazing experience. Lastly, the replay value on this game is amazing. Yes you can have tons of different builds, but the dialogue choices are probably the best I’ve seen in a game. Next play through I will probably be a bad guy. I’m looking forward to seeing how much the game changes.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Dec 1, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I'm so glad that I could play this masterpiece, for almost 3 months exploring its awesome world, knowing the characters, and somehow, transforming them into killing machines for the combats, sometimes frustrating but always satisfactory when they end.

At the beginning, the plot may look "simple" and shallow, but as the story unfolds, you realize that it's so deep and rich that you always will want to know what the hell happens next.

Characters such as Astarion, Shadowheart, and Karlach are one of the reasons that make the game so deep and full of things to do and discover and all of them, including NPCs have they share in the game, I mean, experience. Sometimes they feel repetitive, but somehow amusing, like when you send Gale away to the camp and he says: "Idling away the hours", a quote that I took to myself on these 3 months playing Baldur's Gate 3.

The soundtrack is awesome in all aspects, and the "Mind Flayer Theme" is so much better than many Oscar Awarded musicians.

Thank you, Larian Studios for making this piece of art, that almost made me lose my mind in these 3 months of this GREAT experience that I haven't had since Red Dead Redemption 2. And you guys could do what Rockstar didn't on Grand Theft Auto 5 and Red Dead Redemption 2: some DLCs with new chapters and revisiting places and characters.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 is a breathtaking masterpiece, seamlessly blending immersive storytelling with rich, detailed graphics that transport players into its captivating universe. Every aspect, from the intricately designed characters to the expansive, vibrant world, is crafted with remarkable skill, showcasing a deep respect for the legacy of the Baldur's Gate series. The game's strategic combat system is both challenging and rewarding, encouraging creative problem-solving and tactical thinking. Its narrative is a spellbinding journey, full of complex characters and moral dilemmas, making every choice feel significant. Baldur's Gate 3 is not just a game; it's a shining example of interactive art at its finest. Even though it have some small glitches but it will not affect its overall gameplay.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 29, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur’s Gate 3 is a buggy, inexplicable game that throws a fresh hell at you every single time you figure you’ve got the patterns down. If the constant crashes, annoying characters, maps and quests that don’t actually give you enough to go on without continually referencing walkthroughs don’t send you into flames of fury every five seconds, the fact that it’s a hardline DnD game - to the point where I feel like I meed a player’s manual - will.

If that were all, I’d rate it slightly higher- maybe mediocre - but even the super-duper 5th edition hardline is actually crippled compared to a pen and paper session.

It is tedious, slow, annoying trash that somehow evokes enough fun to get a 2/10. But for the love of all that is holy, don’t expect it to be a fun throwback. This is similar to BG and BG2 in the same way that getting hit in the head with a rock is like having an enjoyable ride on a bicycle.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/RolandOG/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="RolandOG">
    RolandOG
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 19, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>One of the best RPGs I’ve ever played, and by far the best since The Witcher 3. The level of detail, from graphics to mechanics, is astounding. Not only does it reassert the relevance of turn based combat, but in so many ways it’s better than most real time action games. You can speak with almost any NPC in the world - and there are many - and they will perform not just great voice acting, but beautifully expressive motion captures. The world and characters are interesting, and there is infinite replayability. The way they got such a complex game to work so well on a console controller is an absolutely incredible UI/UX achievement. I’m blown away at every turn, and after 40 hours of play, I’ve only scratched the surface. If this doesn’t merit a plethora of GOTY awards, I don’t know what does. The bar has been raised and that could not be more welcome in a gaming era rife with disappointment. There’s a learning curve for those unfamiliar with D&amp;D, but it’s well worth taking the time to acclimate.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Few games has this potential...I would say you can count them on your fingers...

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The story is well paced with many things to do. There are some issues I had with outcomes in the 3rd act since they felt a bit more restrictive when compared to the rest of the game. Some characters did not have enough time to be fleshed out like others leaving me with no reason to use them after completing their story. Gameplay is great allowing creative planning and ways to deal with scenarios. There are some bug issues in the 3rd act that made my game crash at times. Some details don't become rendered in during the 3rd act just due to the shear amount of things on the map. I am bummed that I can only have 4 characters in my party at a time but it makes sense just due to how long it can take between turns. Overall, a great RPG that would recommend to any player.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

The community, the individual experiences, the stories etc generated by this game have been wonderful.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/ontariel/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="ontariel">
    ontariel
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 8, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Is BG3 a good game? Yes!
Is it fun to play? Yes!
Is it the best game ever made? Probably not. There are a few significant shortcomings: 
Some of the companions are poorly designed (I'm looking at you Gale). By itself this is not a big problem, but somehow the game forces you to interact with them over and over again and does not allow you to just ignore them. If possible, I want to remove specific people from my camp since all interactions with them feel very negative, but that's not possible.
The interactions with the companions are weird. It seems as if everyone wants to sleep with each other all the time! Even if I repeatedly say I am not interested, the game shoves romance option after romance option in my face. Maybe a bit more nuance in interpersonal relationships would have helped. Friendships exist, in particular when going out for adventure!
In some instances the pacing feels off. I understand that it cannot be full speed all the time, but every time at the beginning of an act everything seems to go glacial. Maybe a few better defined quests to carry the story forward between acts would have helped. Along these notes: I did not enjoy the transition between acts 2 and 3. After act 2 there is a sense of accomplishment and slowing down and suddenly the game drags you through this...
The autosaves are designed in a hideous way! The game does not save at a reasonable speed at all and does not run fully stable on PS5. There is nothing more annoying than a crash where you have to replay half hour of gameplay you just did. There must be better solutions!
The points I bring up sound overly negative, but I want to highlight that there is a lot of fun to be had in BG3! Exploring the world is interesting, the combat system gives you many options to improve, the story is ok, and there's a lot of weird stuff you can run into that changes how the game goes. Nevertheless, there are a few crucial things missing to really give it a 10/10.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Isantonio86/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Isantonio86">
    Isantonio86

    Nov 5, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>When I saw the reviews I thought was the typical exageration of the moment.
After 5 hours I realised something bigger was happening,  after 20 hours I could not stop singing "down by the river " and after 80hours gameplay I came to the conclusion that I played the best game ever made .
The negative reviews are unfortunately fake and have no idea about the game. 
I hope to everyone to live their own story in BG3 , enjoy your own journey.
I never experienced such perfection and freedom to design my own adventure. 
I wouldn't change a single pixel of this masterpiece.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Stavro246/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Stavro246">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The game is really something special, something you don't get very often.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
