  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I dont remember having this much fun since Witcher 3. An absolute GOTY</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/roman_emperor/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="roman_emperor">
    roman_emperor
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 30, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I like this game. I want to give this game a 10/10, but despite the fascination I have for this game, I have to be objective with my review.

This game has fascinating level design, great character development, and an overall strong story. The side content alone has consumed hours of my time. I'm 60 hrs in and I'm still in act 1 being a thorn in the merchants' side.

The side quests are deep. They are often rewarding and meaningful and have lasting consequences on your overall experience.

However, the game has some major flaws. Some minor. Other major. The worst offender is the inventory system. It is messy and a great deal of your gameplay is spent managing it. However, it is glitchy and causes your game to crash more than often. You have to save before and after making one simple inventory change, otherwise, you will find yourself having to load your latest save, which will lose you a significant amount of progress.

If you store your items in pouches and backpack, there are moments the game will glitch out and you won't be able to access them, especially in combat. It's toss up if I can access my magic scroll or potions from my backpack during combat. Sometimes I can. Sometimes I can't.

Gale, sometimes, will not jump even two meter in front of him during combat whereas every other character can.

You have to walk everywhere. There is no run button, and it can feel painfully slow to **** jog everywhere. Getting from one place to another is often a chore.

Saved data will randomly corrupt.

At this point they have released several patches, but whether the fix all the issues is uncertain. This is a great game. There's a lot of enjoyment, but don't purchase this game expecting a flawless experience. It has immersion breaking issues. I recommend this game, but go into it knowing it isn't a flawless experience.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Lehuan777/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Lehuan777">
    Lehuan777
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 1, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>[SPOILER ALERT: This review contains spoilers.]</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/ZajebioSSa/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="ZajebioSSa">
    ZajebioSSa
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 1, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The game is huge!  I had a great time for 140 hours, but at the same time I was swearing at the D&amp;D mechanics (it was the first time I had to deal with them).  Overall, the game is technically well-made, but in the third act this aspect falls a bit short.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/guiletheguiles/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="guiletheguiles">
    guiletheguiles
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 1, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Well, it doesn't get much better than that.

This is probably one of the most powerful RPGs I've ever played. One of the best games I have played, for sure.

And, to be honest, I don't even enjoy Larian games. I didn't like Divinity 1 and the 2nd one was so boring that I just dropped it. I was worried they'd ruin Baldur's Gate. The second game is a favorite of mine. But they didn't. They knocked it outta the park!

The level of freedom in BG3 is insane. Not only freedom in combat and exploration, but narrative freedom. The ways you can tackle the story, respond to conversations, branching paths, different interactions and events you can stumble upon or create it yourself is just... it's absurd! It all goes farther than it needs and excels at it. Even romance scenes!

This wide range of possibilites transforms this already astonishing story into one of the best fantasy tales I've ever experienced. The writing is incredible, the music is beautiful, visuals are good, the characters absorb you into their backstories and things just keep escalating to major proportions. Hell, even the siquests are enthralling. I can't go into too many details due to spoilers, but trust me, it'll be hard for an RPG to top the storylines and cast you'll encounter here.

In addition to impeccable writing, the other reason why the main plot and its side plots are so captivating has to be the voice acting. There is simply no bad acting here. Hardly any bad characters at all, honestly! And it's not only the main cast. The witty vampire Astarion, the complicated Shadowheart or old companions like Jaheira and Minsc. It's the **** creepy talking ox you meet in act 1, the weird cultists you meet in act 2's tower or even the annoying villains in act 3. It compels you to investigate, understand and finish everything. It's just that convincing and immersive.

If that wasn't enough, BG3 throws one of the best strategy combats at you. A brutal one, due to all the intricate D&amp;D rules, in my opinion, but a fun and rewarding ride. You can tackle each encounter however you like as long as you know what you're doing. It took me a while to get into it, but grasping its possibilites opened up a plethora of opportunities for my party. I completely obliterated, trivialized or even avoided certain fights with the amount of autonomy given to me. But I've made a few battles way harder than they should be, as well. I failed quite a lot, but I learned from trying different things.

There are some amazing encounters and boss fights in this game. There's also an immense amount of **** objectives and gimmicks in others. But you'll fight through it in your own way.

Difficulty was one of the things that I found quite annoying at times. It never felt unbalanced since the game gives you myriad ways to complete an objective or defeat an enemy. But some of the conditions imposed, depending on the blind choices of build and paths you choose throughout the game's 3 acts can turn some very fun set pieces into very cruel moments. One thing I disliked is the amount of mobs you have to fight. My favorite combats were bosses/enemies with three or four strong goons aiding it, not 10 characters coming at you nonstop at the same time.

Being overwhelming might be BG3's biggest triumph, but it can also turn into its biggest flaw. It asks much of you. The good thing, though, is that it always rewards and surprises accordingly.

The main story, although fantasitc, can have its downsides as well. Small ones, and I might be nitpicking here, but act 3 was, by far, the weakest one. Some major decisions and consequences around the final moments of the game felt too sudden. There's a type of "ultimatum" given to you around the ending that felt sort of off character and the final scenes after the final boss were a bit shallow. It wasn't bad, just not as well put together as act 1 and 2, I think.

And last, but definitely not least: this is the buggiest game I've played in a long time.I've encountered MANY different bugs and experienced a few crashes. It can even break some quests or saves, if you don't save often. And BG3's auto-save feature doesn't show up a lot. I even considered lowering the score due to how many bugs I've seen, but I couldn't. I guess it's a "good outweights the bad" situation. For me, at least.

Baldur's Gate 3 is impressive from the moment you boot it up. From character creation, to the thrilling prologue, clean challenging battle system and the friends and enemies you encounter on your journey. Even the main menu is beautiful, they didn't need to go at it that hard.

But they did. And in doing so, they designed the best game I have played in 2023.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I dont get The hype its just a boring piece of bord game</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Artaniel/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Artaniel">
    Artaniel
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 30, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It is definitely the best RPG I have every played and one of the best video games. The variety of choices and consequences, the tailor-made battles, the amount of tiny details, the music and the voice acting, the overall story and the companion stories - everything is just amazing. I was concerned about playing it on PS5, but the interface there is even more convenient than on PC in my opinion. I spent 250 hours just on one playthrough looking at every corner and exploring and I still haven't found some rare loot, met some of the important NPCs or tried some of the classes for a different gameplay experience. If you like RPGs in general this game is definitely a must. At the same time there are some drawbacks as well. I think that the replayability is a bit overhyped. Yes, it is much better compared to majority of other RPGs and you can solve quests in multiple ways, but once you go through a quest, you can pretty much imagine the different possible outcomes. Same goes for battles - they are tailor-made, but that also means that once you go through them - it's not really interesting to do that again. But the biggest disappointment was the ending. Yes, there are many variants, but even 17000 unique endings that Larian promised are actually just a couple major directions and then a bunch of small puzzle pieces tagged on (if you take just 5 puzzle pieces out of a pool of 20 you will already get 15000 combinations, so that number is more PR than actual variability). I mean the game is still amazing while you are playing, it's just that at the end of an epic story it was a bit disappointing to see just several very short cutscenes. Also there could be a higher difficulty setting. If you have experience with turn-based games and just follow very basic combat tactics it is extremely easy even on tactician mode. I played the whole game on tactician without really min-maxing anything and even on hardest bosses had to reload maybe couple of times, mostly because I screwed something up myself. Finally, there are some glitches and bugs here and there, mostly in Act 3, because they obviously spent more time polishing the first 2 acts, but at the same time nothing is game breaking and for a game of such scale it's only natural.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Besides the problems on Act 3 the game is an historical masterpiece for enjoyers of games and RPG in general, my only addups would be like special rewards for completing the game like on Tactician examples: infinite spell-slots and etc just to have fun and chaos kek.

      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/PanchoRedFalcon/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="PanchoRedFalcon">
    PanchoRedFalcon
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 24, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>An RPG in its essence, with the maximum number of choices you can get in a game like this where the paths you take change everything, an immersion never seen in a turn-based RPG game, with an impeccable lore, and respect for the rules of **** this game you choose the direction the story takes and how it ends, as well as whether you will help your partners or simply leave them along the way by following a solo path, hero, villain, or a little of both, it all depends on you in this sensational RPG developed by LARIAN.

What did I find?

I thought it was AMAZING, I had never had such a satisfying experience, with so much freedom, with so much immersion in the game world as in Baldur Gate 3, both in my solo experience and as a duo with my brother it was a unique experience, and if I play more 5 times will be different given the infinite possibilities of doing things differently. There is also the option to play with the original characters and live their story, which changes everything, how can you not enjoy being in the shoes of IMPULSO SOMBRIO, son of…. Anyway, no spoilers, but it's a unique experience **** the hours and hours that I pored over the game, I had fun, I racked my brains to find solutions to problems, I explored all the maps and arrived at different results for the same mission, some happy others not so much, it's not my behavior to bank the villain but for those who like it, there is this option too, you can be the BAD **** game has a wonderful setting, a few immersion, the battle system is simple and easy to understand, if there is a negative point, it is the inventory which is very messy given the impossibility of you selling the rubbish automatically, so you have It has to be filtered, but over time you get used to **** possibility of developing a loving relationship with game partners a la The Witcher 3 (geraldão is happy) is also a highlight of this game, in my gameplays I ended one with umbralma and another with karlach, in both it was cool to look for ways to win over a partner. Furthermore, the game offers a multitude of class and subclass options for you to play, and it is no exaggeration to say that it is a game that you can finish many times without getting bored, given the immensity of possibilities.

Final considerations:

Baldur Gate 3 is the game of the year 2023 in my opinion and if it doesn't win it will be a terrible crime, its gameplay, its lore, its freedom brought the tabletop RPG to the forefront of video game screens, and it is a must-have game for Every good RPG fan, anyone who doesn't play Baldur Gate 3 can't say they like a good RPG. Fantastic, incredible experience that I've never had before in games of this genre. SENSATIONAL. I highly recommend it to everyone!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Oct 24, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Pure gold this is…I remember myself playing Baldurs Gate 2 when I was younger, which was awesome as well….I loved playing Knights of the old Republic, and it feels so good having a game again with the D&amp;D character idea. This game got me hyped up, and I love it. Also how it works on the PS5, still the city needs a FPS update but all in all, this game is such a masterpiece. In no other games you question decisions that much like here. The nightsong quest I needed to restart 3 times to get the right outcome. For all other quests and decisions I leave it running and see what happens when I decide to the best of my knowledge. I am 110 hrs in the game now….there is so much to explore, this is crazy. There are so many moments where you say “wtf”…the dialogs are so well made, the ****. It feels good winning a crucial fight against a boss, when you figured out a good tactic which works out….I could say so much…but this is one of the best games ever made so far.What needs improvement on the PS5 is the FPS level to get 60 all the way and the loading times.I think after my first walk through I will get Divinity Original Sin II – I totally missed that game on my radar. And then a second run in BG3 will follow.A game made with love, without microtransactions, pure story, deep dive in the world – thank you for this!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 23, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>TLDR - Brilliant game soured by cringy developer self inserts.

For : D&amp;D perfection for current gen. Would be a 10 if not for developers acting like cringelords and self-inserting constantly.


Against : Forces certain seggsual preferences to the forefront of pretty much everything. Making it a militant biseggsual simulator doesn't do the brilliant game system justice. You cannot enjoy the spirit of camaraderie present in, say, The Hobbit or LOTR because you can rarely ever say 'Hello' to someone without them offering to jump your bones. It cheapens the experience and sours an otherwise brilliant once-in-a-lifetime experience. Nobody is asking for the deletion of different preferences, simply saying they do not need to be front and centre for everything. There are moments of awful writing straight out of the stalest US TV shows (think Forspoken) and humour from people afraid to make jokes (think reddit).</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>You will like the game if you like role-playing games with very good stories. You'll love it when you have a fabulous for tactical turn-based fights. The game can seem complex/overwhelmed but it is no longer with time.. you are very shallowly led into the game. An absolute treat, the RPG of the year if not even of this decade! 
++++++ 
Very good set dialogues + Very good soundtrack + Very good animations + Very good graphics + Very detailed environment Many different companions with their own background stories + Many twists, unexpected moments + Very high replay value + Fantastic story(s) and main story that also changes depending on decisions OR comes to an end faster than you think (through appropriate decisions) + Many WTF moments + Many WOW moments +++++</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Jobo3010/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Jobo3010">
    Jobo3010
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 18, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Every once in awhile a game comes along that meets the hype, and Baldur's Gate 3 is one of them. Full disclaimer I never played Baldur's Gate before and I know little to nothing about D&amp;D. There was a decent learning curve for this game, but a couple quick Google searches were enough to answer questions that the game didn't explain (or I just missed, the tutorial and aids are helpful without being annoying). The combat is turn based, but easy to figure out, as well as all the other controls for console, which what I was originally worried about with this PC focused fort. All that aside the world, exploration, storytelling, and character interaction are all top notch fantasy RPG stuff. Voice acting is good, face captures are really good for what they are, and the graphics and textures all look next gen.

It's refreshing to see a studio like this, that celebrates selling a game at market price and advocating strongly for the lack of microtransactions. The same studio has laughed larger producers out of the room for trying to acquire them. They have a strong and original vision and the game reflects that. It's not perfect and still has some rough edges, but overall it's a solid release that is better than any AAA title release this year to date.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/RPG_Fanatic/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="RPG_Fanatic">

      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Never played D&amp;D. Never played a CRPG. Never played the first two games. I wasn’t even that interested in this game when it came out this August because I figured the turn-based combat wouldn’t be able to hold my attention. But after hearing about the unanimous hype and the accalim and watching a few interviews by Larian and the VAs, I purchased it. 

I’m 50 hours deep and only just finishing up the first Act. I’ve already started a second play through as a different race and class. And I find myself thinking about the game all the time when I’m not playing it. This game is a masterpiece. I hope everyone involved in the making are very proud of themselves and their creation. They’ve done an incredible job.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 7 out of 10" aria-label="User score 7 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">7</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Amarychan/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Amarychan">
    Amarychan
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 14, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I'm very much in two minds about the game. Some aspects are good to great, but others... not so much. It did not help that my first playthrough was completely ruined by the many, many bugs, glitches and crashes. It should never have been released in that state. The second and third time were slightly better after patches but the further you get in the game the more issues, Act 3 was (and still somewhat is) a mess. Characters talking about a scene that hasn't happened, characters suddenly being naked in a cutscene (and not a character I wanted to see naked :-)), the many crashes, NPC's not following and jumping... 

The character creation is overrated. It's not awful or anything, it's pretty good actually, but having heard it described as one of the best ever, I was disappointed. Only a couple of body types and faces, no options to change facial features (mouth, nose, eyebrows individually), it all feels very samey.

As far as the music is concerned it's okay, inoffensive, but other than a few exceptions, it's pretty forgettable. 

The story overall is pretty good. Your choices have consequences, which is very nice to see. Though Act 3 felt not as polished as 1 and 2. Some of the zones felt underutilized and too short. 

The battle system is sometimes fun and sometimes rather annoying. Having to wait for the AI to make a move every time is awful, especially in fights with sometimes more than a dozen enemies. You might end up waiting a minute and nothing happens. Frustrating.

The voice acting I found to be very good. The companions are, not all too my taste, but all pretty well written.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Crewefox/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Crewefox">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>108 hours for a single playthrough, 108 hours of a perfect gaming experience. I've played irl Dungeons &amp; Dragons for 26 years and never has a video game come this close to replicating the comedy, horror and thrill of a tabletop game.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

    OnlyOneHere
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 16, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I'm not finished with you Larian. My son bought this game on PS5, so that entitles me to review this game one more time. These game journalists and toy-collecting introverted millennials (who are ironically the most vocal on the internet) won't say anything bad about this game, so what I'm about to say needs be addressed. "Enjoy the game to its fullest without any additional costs or microtransactions" is that so? Then why does the PS5 version cost $70? The greedy developers are charging an extra $10 to PS5 owners for absolutely no reason. Technically those $10 are additional costs, meaning that Larian lied. If Larian was the "consumer friendly" company that everyone made them out to be, then why did they join the greedy trend of charging $10 extra for the PS5 version? This is EA behavior right here. ● This is a low quality buggy game for $70. In spite of that, it gets highly praised by critics and the "story made me cry GOTY" millennials. If Skyrim, Witcher 3, and now this garbage is anything to go by, it's pretty obvious that fantasy RPGs get a pass for low quality buggy trash lacking in detail. If it were anything else (especially COD and Ubisoft), these same people wouldn't shut up about it. These type of gamers are never consistent. Let's be honest, this is a $70 mobile game. Now I didn't even want to talk about the wokeness in this game, because literally every AAA game this decade is woke. But I'm getting real sick and tired of these conservative gamers ignoring the obvious wokeness of any game/studio that's an internet darling. They unironically think games like Fallout are anti-woke. I know you anti-woke millennials want to live in your little fantasy world where the best entertainment was made by conservatives, but you have to accept reality. Most game developers are liberals. ● The multiplayer is trash. What do so many games with microtransactions have in common? Most of them as far as I'm aware have a PvP mode. Does this have PvP? Yeah, I didn't think so. I don't ever want to see developers bragging about lack of MTX in their games if it doesn't have online PvP. If you're not greedy and lazy Larian, prove it. Give me a PvP mode. It shouldn't be too hard when so many low budget games have PvP. But let's face it, you won't do it because you know I'm right. And if you do add PvP, I bet you will go against your MTX beliefs. This is a generic RPG mobile game, yet we have developers pretending this is an anomaly in a pathetic attempt to trick gamers into believing this is high quality to decrease workload. No it isn't. A game like GTA V for instance is an anomaly, which is why GTA VI is easily the most anticipated game right now. I don't recommend this game at all. ● P.S. Metacritic, quit deleting reviews you don't agree with. Larian literally lied about no additional costs for BG3. An extra $10 for PS5 owners is an additional cost. That's not even my opinion, it's a fact. Despite the lies being in front of everyone's face, no one is going to acknowledge it, so my review deserves to stay up. If this were COD or sports games, you would've let it slide. This game is just as woke, cringe, broken, and low quality as Saints Row. If the latter is hated, why does this game get a pass? Learn to accept different opinions Metacritic.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Oct 9, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Whilst Act 1 is pure perfection, as you mosey on through to act two, it suddenly takes a small turn for the worst. Bugs, unable to complete certain quests because of said bugs. Textures not loading up properly, being catapulted off of lifts for no reason, crashing my entire PS5 so I had to hard reset it. Act 3  feels rushed,is even worse for all these things, houses etc not loading up properly so you can see everything inside them,. NPC's talking to you but not showing up, or them talking to another character in your party although you were the one to start the conversation. It's like they lost enthusiasm at the final hurdle. The ending, well that left a sour taste in my mouth. After everything you go through as a group, the dialogue suggesting something awesome is coming and will conclude it all nicely, only for the rug to be pulled from under my feet and it cut to black, almost mid sentence, Soprano's all over again .but in a game format. No new game plus, no continuation of running around with your best pals. No end game content whatsoever. If DLC does not come out to expand upon this, then my next playthroughs of this will be met with less enthusiasm, but I want the platinum, so I shall try my best. I just wish they would put in more effort when it comes to endings these days. Bugs I can understand here and there, but for a game that was in development for literal years, beta testing for over two years I believe and met with thunderous praise, it should be in better condition than it is at present.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/MysticCrazy/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="MysticCrazy">
    MysticCrazy
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 6, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Absolutely one of the best video games I have ever played. You can really tell when playing Baldur's Gate 3 that the developers put an incredible amount of time, love, and creativity into it. The amount of content in this game is insane. I'm on my first play through on PS5 and I spent over 100 hours in Act 1 alone and I am currently now at over 300 hours total playtime halfway through Act 3 (and im pretty positive ive even missed some stuff! But that is for my other playthroughs lol). My only criticisms about this game are incredibly minor and I know that Larian is actively working on some of them. Like Act 3 does have most of the bugs I have encountered (none of them game-breaking) but like I said Larian has very clearly been quick and on top of fixing bugs with their frequent hotfixes (like restoring His Majesty back to his lovely bald self) and every game is bound to have bugs but it's on how the developers/creators respond to them that makes or breaks a game IMO. The minor criticisms I have is that I wish there was the option of a customizable camp tent for Tav. I think it would make a lot of sense for us to be able to give Tav a tent just like companions. Also I really love the relationships you can have with the companions and I think they are beautifully written (at least the Astarion relationship) but I do agree with what I've seen other players mention online is that I wish there was the option to not only kiss your romantic partner (which is already available after a certain point) but to be able to hug them at will as well as potentially cuddle with them. Possibly even once you get into Act 3 a date quest where you can spend some quality time with your romantic companion. The last thing is that in a recent hotfix they changed how talking with companions works and now the camera snaps back to Tav after the companion stops talking and I really wish they would revert that change back to how it was before. Before you would talk to your companion and the camera would remain on their face after the dialogue when returning to the dialogue choices and this doesnt have to be with any other characters or NCPs in the game but i think it really enhanced the real feel of the dialogue between Tav and the companions. It was also just plain lovely to be able to see Astarions microexpressions and the amazing animations. But at this point like I said those are really minor honestly they're just wishes I have for the game. The gameplay itself is intriguing and for a complete newbie to D&amp;D and turn based RPGs, is an amazing introduction to the genre, game, and game type. It took a little bit to get the hang of the combat and game play but the tutorial hints help a lot and it was fairly easy to learn as I went through the game. I think this game will introduce many people to the lovely world of D&amp;D who might never have gotten into it otherwise. This was a genius game to make. D&amp;D the video game essentially (also romance simulator lol). The storyline is rich with an incredible amount of lore throughout the game in both story and things you can find and it is a very intriguing story that **** you right in and leaves you wanting more. I would give literally all of my money to Larian for DLC or just any more content in general because I love this game so much. I think this is above and beyond game of the year. It might not seem like much but to finally have a video game that is "finished" with no in game purchases and other predatory gaming practices (like most games have been for the past 5-10 years) with an amazing studio like Larian who very clearly care about their players, is a breath of fresh air and I think is going to hopefully change the game industry for the better. The overwhelming success of the game is a clear statement that gamers have had enough of other developers and studios (particularly AAA studios) treating us like cash cows and that they would see more money and success if they just treated their players with respect. Nobody wants to spend money on a game that isnt good. Also the voice acting is incredible and I hope some of the actors win awards this year. Particularly Neil Newbon. His portrayal of Astarion is some of the best acting I have ever seen in a video game. I cannot overstate how much I love this game. 10/10. Would recommend.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

This game is ONLY for D&amp;D enthusiasts who enjoy story dialogue simulation games.
The gameplay is agonisingly slow, the combat is boring, the story is just pages and pages of dialogue where your choices dictate the following dialogue.

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>3 years of beta wasn't enough to make this buggy **** playable?!

this is the single buggiest game i've ever played. textures never fully load, it crashes frequently, quest lines are broken because the game can't remember what i have/haven't done, sometimes audio just cuts out, i get lots of combat and fast travel bugs - characters spawn on top of buildings, or under the floor, stuck in the ground, sometimes - etc. the game keeps spoiling itself by triggering dialogue about plot points i haven't gotten to yet. items disappear from inventory. for $80, after all this time working on the game, you'd really expect it to be playable. but you'd be expecting too much, apparently. and that's not even taking into account the time the game was down on PS5 and no one could get into it...</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 é uma obra-prima que transcende as expectativas dos fãs do gênero. Com uma narrativa profunda, jogabilidade cativante e um mundo de fantasia meticulosamente elaborado, o jogo oferece uma experiência verdadeiramente excepcional.

Narrativa Épica e Personagens Memoráveis
Gráficos Deslumbrantes e Ambientes Ricos
Jogabilidade Tática e Desafiadora
Criação de Personagens Profunda e Significativa
Interatividade Inigualável com o Ambiente
Escolhas Morais Complexas e Consequências
Trilha Sonora Imersiva
Atualizações Frequentes e Suporte Ativo

Em resumo, Baldur's Gate 3 é uma obra-prima do gênero RPG, que une narrativa, jogabilidade e ambientes excepcionais. A profundidade da experiência oferecida é impressionante, e o jogo se mantém fiel às raízes da série, enquanto inova e surpreende. É um must-play para qualquer fã de RPG</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Es perfecto</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Masku/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Masku">
    Masku
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 25, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Wow, just wow. This was my first time ever playing a turn-based RPG and I didn’t know anything about D&amp;D going into this. I usually play games like GTA, FIFA and shooters, so I did not expect to like or understand this game. I was wrong. The first hours were hard. I did not understand the fighting mechanics and I was close to giving up.  As you can see from this review, I did not.. I decided to play a little bit more, and 2 hours turned into 5 hours, and 5 hours turned into 50 hours, and 50 hours to 100 hours…. This is the best story I have ever experienced in a game. All the choices, mistakes and accomplishments matters and I am able to craft my own story. How is it even possible to make a game where there is a story line for ever possible outcome? I can’t wrap my head around how much time and passion the developers must have put in to this. I played it for so long and did so many quests, but I still feel like I just scratched the surface of the game, and I am ready to play it again and do things differently. I usually never want to play the story from a single-player game more than once, but I feel like I can play this 5 more times and have completely different experiences and outcomes. I still don’t understand half of it, and the game is hard,  but that is just fine. There is so much to learn, so many more stories to experience. I finally understand why so many people like these type of games. 10/10! Btw, remember to backup save all the time! I learned that the hard way…</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 7 out of 10" aria-label="User score 7 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">7</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/gotchicken70/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="gotchicken70">
    gotchicken70
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 25, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Ill start by saying I have been enjoying my time with this game and am partway through the final act. That being said, this might be the most overrated game I have ever played. I am long time DnD player and they have done a great job of translating that experience from tabletop to videogame. The storylines, characters, charm, player-choice and voice acting in this game are top notch - but this is a very flawed game.

This game has one of the worst interfaces I have ever experienced. Managing your inventory is a horrible chore with broken sort and too many similar icons. This game is full of bugs, I have reached multiple broken states that forced me to reload saves over an hour old. I even had to completely restart a campaign after 2 hours due to a story-breaking bug. The animations and graphics often bug out. This game also suffers from some player choices that are a bit too confusing - I'll often pick a response thinking I am being "good" with the outcome being my entire party hates me and I'm now in combat. I'm fine with a little bit of vagueness but sometimes the dialogue does not match the outcome. Needless to say I save almost non-stop to mitigate these issues. There have also been multiple times where I wind up in a "dead-end" where I can't complete the situation in the way I want to with the characters I want to without going back several hours. The gameplay can also be quite tedious, AI takes too long to process their turns and there is no way to speed up turn-based combat animations. Stealth is extremely tedious as trying to get the entire party into stealth is again a horrible failure of user interface.

Overall, BG3 is a faithful and passionate recreation of tabletop DnD that results in a good game - one that could've been amazing if not for the deluge of bugs and horrible ui/ux.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 7 out of 10" aria-label="User score 7 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">7</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/phidget/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="phidget">
    phidget
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 25, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Whilst I appreciate the incredibly depth in this game and the vast amount of choices you have at your disposal I often can't get over some of the bugs on PS5 and some gameplay choices that I find a little too much.

I love these kinds of strategic games and the complexity of them however I haven't played them for such a long time so it felt quite punishing to come to this with very little in the way of guidance. A few quests to introduce some of the quirkier mechanics and get your brain into it wouldn't go amiss for sure and it would certainly attract a lot of newcomers to the genre.

Gameplay wise there are still a few bugs. There's a quest that's been broken for 3 years and now I'm stuck being unable to complete it - why on Earth has this not been fixed yet and despite having a huge patch drop lately with a ton of bug fixes this is still broken. I've also come across at least two areas where there was poison but nothing appeared and I walked into it unawares - a quick re-load and the green mist suddenly appears. There's still a bundle of little bugs like that which spoil your immersion and enjoyment.

Some of the sections in the game that require jumping can be very annoying as I've found I can jump up a ledge with one character but not another and even then I have to stand in a pixel perfect spot - if this is tied to some stat then fair enough if I missed that but give me a break once in a while - not everything needs to be such a skill/stat check as it just grinds everything to a needless halt and there are moments where progress feels like running in treacle. Pathing for your companions also can be a bit broken, they'll often get stuck near jumps and even though they can make it you have to muck about switching characters to get them to do anything so that again breaks the immersion and enjoyment.

It can be a little frustrating at times as well - one quest had me find an npc for more information but he died in an earlier fight. I searched online and found that you're meant to use the spell to talk to the dead but then it says it sustained too much damage. Great - now I'm stuck on that one then. 

Don't get me wrong here - there is a fantastic game here with a lot of content, creativity and replay value to keep you going for a long time. The characters are all fleshed out and get you attached to them quickly. Combat is fun with tons of options which is also true of the character building side of it. I just wish they took a little more time to ease you into it - I'm not after training wheels like in most games, just a little extra in the very early stages to get you going in the right direction that's all.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/ZXSth/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="ZXSth">
    ZXSth
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 23, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I struggled greatly with deciding on what to score Baldur's Gate 3 - it is absolutely amazing, but wondered whether it is truly a "perfect" 10, or a solid 9.5. In the end, I decided that it deserves the benefit of the doubt - while I believe this game has some technical hiccups that deserve attention, this is an utterly remarkable game. I do not feel like I am jumping on the bandwagon of praising this game by saying that while I think I might need time to mull the possibility, it very well could be among the best video games I've ever played.

My sole gripes with this game involve two aspects: Its similarities to Divinity: Original Sin 2 in terms of gameplay, and its somewhat frequent crashes and bugs (an expected consequence of a CRPG of this magnitude). Having said that, it is probably the least buggy console port of a CRPG I've played yet, and the company is set on very quickly ironing out all technical issues as they arise. Furthermore, the game does enough to differentiate itself from Original Sin 2 that if you look beyond the surface, you see a game with not only incredible writing, sound design, voice acting and overall aesthetic appeal, but solid levels of mechanical depth as well, with some of the most enjoyable and detailed character-building I've ever seen in a video game.

I will not mince words: This game really has it all. It is extremely fun to play through. It has astounding levels of replay value. The characters are all relatively well-written, likeable and engaging. The music is excellent. I would argue that just about every aspect of this game draws you in and keeps you there. It is utterly impeccable.

I always strive to look at games with an unbiased lens, and not allow myself to be swept up in the hype around a new game. In this case, I truly believe that the hype is deserved. Baldur's Gate 3 deserves your time, money and interest - it is a masterpiece.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/DavLai3/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="DavLai3">
    DavLai3
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 23, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>What a remarkable achievement! Finished the game and rolled credits at 110 hours. An incredible masterpiece that features some of the best characters and world building of any rpg in history. Great combat. Wonderful music and writing. I absolutely loved every minute of this game. Larian Studios along with SquareEnix and MonolithSoft are the now the absolute best RPG developers on the planet. The love that went into this game is a beautiful thing and the fans salute all your hard work.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

    Sep 21, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldurs Gate possui uma trama incrível com uma gameplay refinada e gráficos muito acima da média para o seu gênero. Joga-lo é simplesmente envolvente. 

A obra apresenta alguns bugs gráficos e problemas de performance, mas isso não ofusca seu brilho. Sem dúvidas um título acima do oferecido pela indústria atualmente. A Larian Studios certamente elevou o nível e mostrou o que acontece quando arte e jogo se encontram.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

    Sep 19, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Despite what the PS5 reviews are saying to try and be only positive, there's some important con's that keep it below a 5. Baldur's Gate 3 on PC is amazing. A masterpiece **** where the graphics are tremendous and gameplay is investing and brings you in for the long haul. Rarely will you stumble upon glitches or bugs, or anything game breaking. On PS5 however, it will constantly freeze in battles, framerates drop in larger battles [which are everywhere like the Goblin fortress], and the system runs hot during these times. Really hot. I'd recommend making sure you have proper ventilation. Outside that the story is the same obviously. Gameplay is the same but slower on console. You won't notice unless you played the seamless PC version first of course.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Даже насчитывая более ста часов, она не перестает удивлять и впечатлять глубоким сюжетом, гипнотическими злодеями, соблазнительными компаньонами, миром, в котором можно заблудиться навсегда, и боевой системой, поощряющей творческий подход.     Rinkano
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 14, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 is a masterwork of cinematic storytelling with compelling, deep characters, uniquely crafted tactical encounters and a new secret behind every nook and cranny. But the most fascinating thing is, how many options you as a player have in solving quests or handling conflicts, making every run-through an impressively unique and memorable experience. There is no filler in this game, every sentence feels impactful and important, every quest feels fresh and intriguing, every item you get has it's place in a build you just have to try. Baldur's Gate 3 **** the borders of what we thought to have been possible in RPGs and videogames in general, and this seemingly with ease. I don't think we will see a game like this in many many years, if ever. Just be aware, I don't know a single person that started this game and didn't get lost in it. You will not be able to stop playing once you started. So make sure you only start the game if you truly have the time to spare.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Sep 14, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 is an absolute masterpiece! The immersive storytelling, rich character development, and stunning graphics transport players to a fantastical realm like never before. The strategic combat system keeps you on your toes, while the intricate dialogue choices truly make you feel like the hero of your own epic tale. The attention to detail is astonishing, from the meticulously designed environments to the diverse array of quests. Larian Studios has truly outdone themselves with this gem, creating a gaming experience that will be remembered for years to come.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
