      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Henryt78/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Henryt78">
    Henryt78
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 13, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is amazing. I enjoyed myself so much on the Steam Deck that I immediately pre-order the PS5 version the moment they announced it. It took me a minute to get fully accustomed, and was kind of just playing it straight. Then I discovered I can improvise in battle just just like a D&amp;D tabletop game. Pushing a boss down a deep dark hole, after drinking a strength potion, had me in stitches. That was the moment I realized that I just need to have fun with this. 

While that level of freedom is fun, along with the solid rpg mechanics, it’s the characters that hooked me. Every character is so well acted and nuanced. They draw you in and you want to see how their story plays out. Then with all of the dialog options, and the choices you make, it already has me looking forward to future play throughs.

As for the difference between the PC and PS5 version, Larian made a mouse and keyboard game play great on console. Even if you’re not a fan of CRPGs or top down views, you can change your perspective to 3rd person when walking. Though for battles top down is best. Also I’m just getting to Act 3. Between Steam Deck and PS5, I’ve had this game for almost two months. That’s how much content is in Acts 1 &amp; 2. That’s how much there is to do.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/CLos55/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="CLos55">

Nothing I can say unless you play it and you should play it.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5

    Sep 12, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It is literally they best RPG to release in modern times. Decisions matter, exploration is rewarding, and most of all everything feels handcrafted. The encounters and environs aren't just procedural filler or copy and pasted assets populated with random respawning enemies. It has the cumbersome baggage that CRPGs tend to all come with in terms of controls, Ui, and inventory, but Bottom line, its just a blast to play and get lost in. IT It's just so good, period.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 11, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Estou jogando no ps5 e tô achando um jogo realmente muito bom. Eu coloquei na dificuldade mais fácil pois tinha medo das mecânicas e tô conseguindo jogar muito bem. Ainda há bastante desafio. Mas é totalmente possível jogar. Já tenho 20 horas e todo surpreende. Acombate delicioso. Depois que você entende que há movimentos com custo de magia, movimento que você sempre pode fazer sem custo e que são 2 ações. Uma ação e um truque as ideias começam a vir e o jogo vai virando. Vai fluindo. Realmente é muito bom. Infelizmente há queda de fps na exploração. Mas nada que me deixasse com dor de cabeça nem algo que me irritasse como já aconteceu com outros jogos. É um jogo MUITO imersivo. Ritmo de um ótimo livro que vai se desenrolando tranquilamente. Muito gostoso e interessante. Realmente recomendo e nunca havia jogado um jogo assim. Bem diferente de final fantasy, persona, the witcher. Talvez the Witcher seja o que levemente mais pareça. Eu gosto de fire emblem e tem algo levemente semelhante. Então seria uma mistura entre um the witcher 3 com fire emblem nas minhas referências. Universo incrível. O jogo flui. Você senta pra jogar e as coisas se desenvolvem e te envolvem. Muito bom. Já tinha experiências altas e só tinha medo da complexidade. Mas não precisa ter esse medo. Realmente o jogo consegue desenrolar mesmo que te assuste um pouco no início. Mesmo com os leves probleminhas de performance pontuais, para mim, é nota 10.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

The design of the game itself forces you to constantly reload and save like crazy, resulting in fustrating trial and error with long loading times.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/SkeetsAndYeets/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="SkeetsAndYeets">
    SkeetsAndYeets
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 10, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Starting this review off by saying I've played both on PC and PS5 and I'm leaving this review on the PS5 version to offset the review bombs by fanboys that are mad the game isn't currently on Xbox due to the technical issues Larian had with the Series S. My actual score would be a 9.8 if I could make a more customizable score. With the .2 of a point being knocked off for things like the somewhat annoying inventory systems, an example being you can't access inactive companions' inventories leading to clunky management to sort inventories. Also there are some annoyances with the camera and NPCs (generally being friendly NPCs) choosing the dumbest/useless choices/moves in combat. Other than those few things though the game is the closest to a perfect game in years, from the voice acting and characters, to the choices and consequences, and the music is amazing as well, and despite all the variables in scenes the music generally fits perfectly and improves the scenes. The options in both combat and exploration are massive and your class or classes add even more. As this review is for the PS5 version I should mention the controller controls, despite importing my level 12 character finding all my spells and abilities was pretty easy to do (and in some ways even better/easier than with the Keyboard and Mouse controls) and the framerate, other than the actual city of Baldur's Gate, was mostly good/steady, and to get an nearly stable framerate you could use the 30FPS mode as well.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

An incredible attention to detail in all aspects of gameplay, and next level production; based in a setting with over 30 years of content and lore and not only draws on these influences to enrich the experience but also perfectly compliments it. The game not only deeply respects player feedback (having been in Early Access for a number of years + frequent patches that incoporate player feedback) but also treats players with respect players with no microtransactions or shady corpo shenanigans.

- You like Dungeons &amp; Dragons

A game that will be a cult game and an example to follow for many years to come for video game developers. This game has a unique ability to make you think about your next play through while you're still playing your current one.
The Narrator voice is always on point, BG3 is the kind of game we, players have been waiting for so long.
NO MICRO-TRANSACTION, no half-cooked trash, FUN AND ENJOYABLE GAME.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Jarek0/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Jarek0">
    Jarek0
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 10, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>"Baldur's Gate 3" is an absolute masterpiece of the RPG genre! It's a game that effortlessly transports you to a rich, immersive world filled with endless adventure and unforgettable characters.

The graphics are stunning, with breathtaking landscapes and meticulously detailed character models that make you feel like you're truly part of the Forgotten Realms. The level of visual detail is mind-blowing, from the flickering torches in dark dungeons to the intricate spell effects that light up the battlefield.

But it's not just about looks; the gameplay is nothing short of exceptional. The deep and strategic combat system keeps you on your toes, while the intricate dialogue choices and branching narratives ensure that every decision you make matters. Your character's development is incredibly flexible, allowing you to shape your own destiny in this vast and captivating world.

The storytelling in "Baldur's Gate 3" is top-notch, with a compelling main plot and numerous side quests that are just as engaging. The voice acting is superb, bringing the characters to life in a way that's both emotionally resonant and entertaining. You'll find yourself forming genuine connections with the diverse cast of characters you meet along your journey.

What truly sets this game apart is the sense of freedom it offers. Whether you're negotiating with NPCs, exploring hidden caves, or battling terrifying monsters, every moment feels like an opportunity for adventure. The choices you make ripple through the narrative, leading to multiple endings and countless hours of replayability.

In short, "Baldur's Gate 3" is a triumph in the world of RPGs. It's a game that will captivate you with its beauty, challenge you with its depth, and thrill you with its storytelling. If you're a fan of the genre or simply looking for an epic gaming experience, don't hesitate to embark on this extraordinary journey. It's a true masterpiece that will leave you craving more!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/LarianSimps/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="LarianSimps">
    LarianSimps
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 9, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Like Larian's other games, the quality drops off the more you progress through the game. This isn't a Game of the Year title letalone game of the decade.   </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Exclusive Titles: PlayStation has a history of strong exclusive game titles developed by both first-party and third-party studios. These exclusive games often receive more attention and resources, allowing for higher levels of polish.

Development Support: Sony provides development support and resources to studios working on PlayStation-exclusive titles, which can lead to improved game quality.

Quality Control: Sony's rigorous quality control standards for games published on their platform help ensure that only polished and well-optimized games are released to the public.

Consistent Hardware: PlayStation consoles have a consistent hardware platform, which allows developers to optimize their games more effectively, leading to better performance and fewer technical issues.

Development Time: Many PlayStation exclusives have longer development cycles, giving developers more time to refine and polish their games.

Financial Investment: Sony's financial backing can result in larger budgets for game development, enabling studios to invest in advanced technology, graphics, and gameplay mechanics.

Attention to Detail: Developers working on PlayStation titles often pay meticulous attention to detail, including graphics, storytelling, and gameplay mechanics, which contributes to the overall polish of their games.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is a must-play for any PS5 owners. The performance is flush and steady, the characters &amp; environments are vibrant, &amp; the story is engaging as you can almost do anything that you want in any situation thrown at you. The only reason I’m not giving it a 10 is because I believe that the game could use some QOL updates such as armor/weapon transmog, dye previews, &amp; relationship tracking.

Side note: apparently Larian has patched how “horny” your companions are because they were not supposed to be so engaging originally.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Played this on PC first. PS5 version is second for better co-op experience, from the standpoint that my family is remote and they don't have all PC's.  LOVE this game. So many choices and so much variety.  You have to like this game style, but if you are a DnD or Pathfinder player, this shouldn't be an issue. If your a Call of Duty player and looking for more of the same, this is not the game for you.  I do wish we could use a mouse/keyboard on the PS5 though, as it does help manage the overwhelming amount of things you can do more efficiently than a controller. On the flip side, they have done some amazing things with the controller implementation. Looking forward to cross-play as well.  Overall, this is the best DnD game EVER MADE, and I've been around for 5 decades of gaming going back to the old Pong across many platforms.  Larian has done an exceptional job and they deserve all the praise they get for their hard work and their continued efforts in bringing out the best of the game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    CheckCallin
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 8, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 is an absolute gem in the world of RPGs. The game's rich storytelling, intricate character development, and stunning visuals immediately draw you into its immersive world. The depth of choices and consequences makes every decision feel impactful, ensuring a highly personalized gaming experience. What truly sets Baldur's Gate 3 apart is its engaging party dynamics, where each character feels distinct and integral to the narrative. While Starfield has its merits, Baldur's Gate 3's intricate storytelling and character-driven gameplay provide a level of immersion and emotional investment that's hard to match. It's a must-play for any RPG enthusiast.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is truly amazing! This is coming from someone who has never really enjoyed turn based combat in games and also hasn’t really shown an interest in the world of D&amp;D. So far I’m about 40 hours into the game. I’m still on act one and can’t put this game down! The world is beautiful, and I can’t help exploring every inch of it! The characters are very well written and all feel real and worth investing time into. The combat is fun and engaging. I find myself really enjoying the turn based combat. I’ve never really enjoyed it but with this game I’ve gone into it with an open mind and it’s actually a lot of fun working out what I can do and how I can take out the enemies. This game is a breath of fresh air and it’s nice to play a game at launch that is completely finished and not a broken buggy mess. Yes there are some issues with frame rates but nothing game breaking. And I’m very happy with the idea that this game has no microtransactions no payed dlc it’s a one time payment and you have hundreds of hours of content. The studio really should be proud of themselves for putting a lot of love and care into a game, one that is easily my contender for game of the year!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

I'm glad we've been blessed with such a great game and don't understand the partially bad reviews here at all.

The performance is great, also there are almost no bugs or dropouts. So definitely a super good game that you can't go wrong with. Because of the poorer performance in act 3 but still 9/10 until the problem is fixed.

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Fabinho69/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Fabinho69">
    Fabinho69
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 8, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate III is a turn-based CRPG with an absolutely fantastic story and a lovingly crafted game world. For me, it is one of the best games of all time because it gives me every freedom to shape the story in my own direction.  However, this may be considered a "risk" by some players. You are not taken by the hand like in Ubisoft games, but have to work out your own adventure (which i LOVE in a rpg). This happens through discovery, conversations with NPCs and a few (but not too many) fixed main story points. If you do this, then you are rewarded with a really immersive RPG experience.

Furthermore, I find the quality of the game convincing across all three acts. Content-wise, I even like the third act the best, as it has some incredibly epic quest lines that put just about any other RPG to shame. From time to time, however, there are still minor performance bugs in this Act. Nothing too bad though, give it a try.

As a conclusion, if you fancy an incredible role-playing experience, this is your game. 10/10 :)

The following tips:

- talk to almost all NPCs

- save frequently

- don't forget the Speak with animals and Speak to dead spells, as they give you access to some of the best content.

- When fighting, remember that not only damage is important, but also the number of moves your player and opponent make and penalty and attack rolls. Therefore, frequently use support spells and potions. There are some great Youtube-videos that may help you out!

I am glad, that finally a game is worth it again in 2023.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

There are diablo fans (haters), there are those who forgot that Final Fantasy hasn't been turn based for 20 years and want new games to be turn based and then there are those who like to go along with hypetrain, without even caring if the game is actually any good.

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>When a game manages to make you think about it and play it with your mind even when you're not sitting at the console and waiting for the time to pass to re-enter this beautiful world and continue your journey then somewhere there you just realize that you are dealing with a real masterpiece. Incredible gameplay mechanics with tons of different approaches to a battle, fantastic depth to the characters, you really bond with them and literally get into the role you're playing with your character and fantastic co-op, incredible that a game like this in 2023 supports split screen couch local co-op which really works and in a very interesting renewed way. Being able to give a dualsense to a friend at any time and to sit side by side and play together with the screen switching incredibly smoothly to split screen and back to full screen, without having to enter a different menu, is an experience that can only be described as positive. It's been a while since I've gotten so hooked on a game and what makes it even better is that we're already in a very good year for gaming as there have already been very good games released across all systems and the year isn't even over yet strong releases are coming and the Baldur's Gate III is up against games that, had they been released in previous years, would have easily won the GOTY. So glad we had a chance to get a game this level in such a long time!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Fallenlords/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Fallenlords">
    Fallenlords
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 8, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I struggle with turn based games, I just don't have the mind that can think three moves ahead.  But at the same time, I love these types of game.   Because more often than not, there is a good story to be had beyond the general gameplay.  Baldur's Gate 3 straight for the start had me hooked, great opening to a game.   Wonderful characters, good story ... just everything about the game is polished.

I feel a little out of my depth, with some of the DnD aspects having never played.   But I think the game does a good job of making it accessible to people like me, and peaks an interest that I didn't know was there.  The world building here is fantastic with some quite adult themes, that surprised me a little as more often than not in games these days we shy away from things.

Holding my own in combat, which surprised me. Found the odd encounter difficult, but went away levelled up a bit and went back to fare better.   I think, not to view every encounter as a fight, is probably a good way to go.  You can avoid things, with a bit of charm, charisma or just arrogance.  And be wary of your environments.  There is so much you can use to your advantage or enemies can likewise use that might not be initially apparent.

Finally, a game that has met and even exceeded my expectations, I was beginning to think it was never possible to experience that again.   But hats off to Larian they have delivered with this game.  And even if these types of games are not your bag, the RPG elements are worth it in themselves.   Fantastic game with loads of replay value.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Cross save function works flawlessly if you wait for the sync to finish before closing the game (I lost a small amount of progress switching between Steam and PS5 when I didn't wait)...

The cross save is wild. It means I can bring it with me on the go with the steam deck, and play on my big screen seating on my sofa at home.

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Obadiah_Jenkins/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Obadiah_Jenkins">
    Obadiah_Jenkins
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is one of those rare games that actually deserve a 10/10, we haven't seen one in awhile. A complete game, with no micro-transactions, no FOMO mechanics, no battle pass, Bauldr's Gate 3 stands on its own two legs without the need for manipulative corporate addiction tactics to keep a player base. Ignore the toxic negative review bombing, check their profiles they will have given Zelda or Starfield a 10 and BG3 a 0. Any sane person loves this game.

I have already played well over 280 hours on PC and 48 hours on PS5, across 4 different playthroughs (some incomplete) and loved every second of it. I play DnD 5e regularly, and this is the closest thing in the video game world to simulating what it's like. The voice acting and facial expressions are outstanding, the story is captivating. The world design is stunning, the combat is so fun and feels exactly like DnD 5e with a few quality of life changes, I'm so glad they made it turn-based unlike the previous two Bauldr's Gates. You just can't have DnD without turn base combat, it doesn't work! This is by far the best Bauldr's Gate so far and definitely the best CRPG I have ever played. Act 3 could do with a touch up, but knowing Larian, they will go above and beyond to polish any shortcomings, which is why it won't affect my rating.

Pay no heed to most of the negative reviews, other than the few disappointed by the current endings of act 3 (which still doesn't warrant giving it a negative rating at all). The other negative reviews are just toxic review bombers who are either insane homophobes, bots, DnD hater's or just people who want their pet video game (probably Zelda/Starfield players) to win GOTY. These degenerates are trying their hardest to bring down the score and defame this absolute gem ****. Report them.

Well done Larian, you successfully achieved what you set out to do, polish act 3, fix more of the epilogues and you have made one of the best video games in history! Pay attention gaming industry, be like Larian.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/month32/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="month32">
    month32
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 is not the same as the other 2 entries of the series. It has none of the Black Isle design or logic. This is a solid Larian studios that, using the Forgotten Realms campaign setting and the lore that has been developed for it for over 40 years, create a good, immersive game. The plot is engaging and there are so many thing to do sidequest wise that you feel like the world is your candy shop.

Which leads to the negatives... There are areas and characters that have suffered even though there was a huge development cycle (looking at you Karlach!), with some side quest endings feeling rushed and not as good as one would have hoped. There are no bags of holding (HERESY!) and there are times where the engine stutters and you miss cinematic moves during a dialogue. And apparently everyone in the realms is thirsty and gender is a suggestion!

All in all, a really good, solid Larian game. If you like CRPGs or RPGs in general you should at the very least try it.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Zanfers/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Zanfers">
    Zanfers
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I was about to give a 9 for the reasons I explain below, but I see so many irrationally low scores "because it is turn based".

So overall, GOTY, game of the decade, possibly the best crafted game I have ever played.

Also a great port, I hope this controller interface becomes a new standard for CRPGs in consoles.

So I can't add much to that. I can tell my issues with the game:

-Companions are too horny. Some shouldn't be romanceable. I miss good "comradeship" type of relationship with them. Like just hitting a tavern or something.
-No dynamic weather system, or at least not a very cool set of weather effects. Weather gives so much to the ambience of games. They should really have this.
-Same with day and night cycle. I understand that you camp in the night, but I would very much enjoy exploring the same places in the night.
-Buggy jump AI. (Oftentimes companions don't follow you jumping, you have to do it manually for everyone, which on console is a bit tedious sometimes.

I think that's it.

Amazing game, I know people who never played D&amp;D or turn based games and they love it too. Give it a go.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This has been a fantastic experience for me. I just cannot believe how amazing this game is and what an incredible leap forward from Baldur’s Gate 2. The graphics are beautiful and stunning, the dialogue is top-notch and well acted. The amount of effort that’s gone into preparing this game (year+ early access) to mould the game into what fans want and iron out bugs as meant it’s easily the game of the year. I’ve read one criticism in a user review of them not liking how it’s turn-based. The thing is you have the option to turn that off and revert to real-time with pause; they haven’t removed it, it’s just that users have decided they prefer turn-based. Personally, I love this new style of combat. As for issues with Act 3, we’ll I’m not there yet so can’t comment except to say, I’m certain the developers will work incredibly hard to remedy these and are likely to be PS5 related issues. Hold your breath and I’m sure they’ll be fixed.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/mdk567/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="mdk567">
    mdk567
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>내 인생 최고의 턴제 RPG.

장점

- 전작의 개발 경험으로부터 이어진 지형지물과 사물을 적극적으로 이용해야 하는 전투 시스템
- 모든 대화에 모션캡처와 더빙이 입혀져 npc들과의 상호작용이 흥미로움
- 그들이 어떤 인물들인지 더 찾아보게 만드는 매력적인 인물 조형
- 훌륭한 품질의 OST
- 맵을 돌아다니는 것에 시간을 투자할수록 더 많은 이야기를 경험할 수 있는 가득 차있는 지역들
- 다양한 상황 해결방식으로 저레벨에서 전투를 생략하는 것이 이득이 되기도 함
- 서브 퀘스트와 메인스토리 사이의 상호작용 방식. 퀘스트를 어떻게 진행하는지에 따라 다른 여러 퀘스트들에 영향을 미치며 게임 초반의 선택이 후반에 영향을 미치기도 하는 스토리 디자인

단점

- 가방 모드를 사용하게 만드는 끔찍한 인벤토리 디자인
- 3막의 최적화. 패치로 개선되고 있음
- 너무 많은 퀘스트와 인카운터를 한 지역에 몰아넣은 3막. 1막과 2막의 디자인에 비해 아쉬움
- 진행 불가능한 버그가 발생할지 예측할 수 없기 때문에 자주 저장해줘야 함</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    TrentDarko
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur’s Gate 3 is an absolutely incredible game that immerses players in a captivating story world with a rich narrative. In this review, I want to focus on the PS5 version, which is a fantastic port of the game. However, I must mention that for newcomers to the Dungeon &amp; Dragon genre, the game can be quite challenging. It may take some time to grasp the intricacies of the combat system and understand how key decisions are determined by dice rolls. If you're new to D&amp;D, I would recommend choosing a class that is less complex to make your initial experience more enjoyable.

One of the remarkable features of Baldur’s Gate 3 is the two different ways you can play it: point and click or free roam. Personally, I highly recommend the point and click option as it allows you to swiftly explore the map and locate the characters' desired destinations. Nevertheless, both methods offer a great gameplay experience.

The characters in this game are truly fascinating and bring the game's story world to life. The art direction in Baldur’s Gate 3 is exceptional, with each area having its own unique story and purpose, contributing to the overall journey of the characters. Prepare yourself for numerous favors to complete for other characters and difficult decisions to make. From my perspective, this has been one of the most memorable gaming experiences since Elden Ring. Without a doubt, Baldur’s Gate 3 deserves the title of game of the year. Once you embark on your journey, you'll quickly become fully engrossed in it. The writers have done an incredible job of captivating us right from the beginning with their engaging dialogue. In fact, whoever wrote the dialogue deserves a trophy for their exceptional work. The game offers a plethora of funny, emotional, and dark moments that will keep you entertained throughout. I highly recommend this game to everyone, regardless of whether you're a fan of RPG or D&amp;D. It's an experience that everyone should have the pleasure of enjoying.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3 is a masterpiece of an rpg no it's a game of the generation by far. As someone who plays mostly jrpgs and other western rpgs like Skyrim or The Witcher I find Baldur's Gate 3 a deep, rich rpg at it's core. Sure Baldur's Gate 3 or D&amp;D may not be everyone's cup of tea but for me who actually never plays CRPGs like Pathfinder or Divinity Original Sin, this game has made me a new fan of the genre. Everything that I wanted in a rpg is packed in Baldur's Gate 3..story, written with absolute love. Each choices is has a meaning and impacts the story as well. From the start it took me literally 1 hour in character creation to read each class and spells and make my character to how I want to roleplay. Characters are heavily voiced acted and my word npcs have voices and most all have unique things to say. Never thought a game like this would have me stay up late especially work days. I called out 3 days straight because this game has hooked me since early access for PS5. The music is absolutely a Grammy winner here, even the creation customization has epic and smooth music it never re-loops. The imagination runs wild on this game..I blocked the door way with chests when you face the first boss in the prologue so the boss doesn't bring his minions the boss was easy and stole the boss's weapon and take it for my own.

It does have technical issues yes but they are minor and easily can be patch out. My score is a 10! A Masterpiece that defines to what an rpg should be.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>As someone who’s played this game on PC and then my PS5 through cross save, I can honestly say that those who gave this game a rating of zeros and 1’s because of Act 3 is unfounded and are lying. But enough of that, this game is the best RPG hands down ever created (game of the year)  and must be emulated by other studios especially since they aren’t even a AAA developer.  I’ve put in hundreds of hours in the game and each new playthrough can be played differently depending on your class, stats and moral alignment resulting on multiple endings.  This is a game that you can definitely play for years to come either solo, couch co-op or online multiplayer.

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Hands down best RPG you could play. I bought it both on PC and on PS5. The mechanics work almost flawlessly on controller it has some slight jack, but it hasn't taken away from my immersive experience. Role-Playing just about any character you could want has never been easier than with this game at least in my personal experience.  For my PS5 playthrough I decided to play as a half elf bard and conman. It's been quite the fun experience bringing this character to life and tackling situations as he would have in my mind. The story and characters are extremely compelling and the maps are massive. Reactivity is at an all time high. Combat is some of the best I've played and this is coming from someone who usually hates turn based Combat. This system won me over though for building my party effectively paying attention to the environment, and strategizing on using it with my abilities to the fullest. It feels like a loving breathing world and it's refreshing to have a game where I'm not special I'm just a dude with a worm in my head with other people with the same issue. Here's to many more adventures in Faerûn. Huzzah!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    KillianZane
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Baldur's Gate 3, the latest installment in this beloved RPG series, is a mixed bag for me. The biggest point of contention lies in its shift to turn-based combat. While some players appreciate the added strategic depth this change brings, I miss the fast-paced real-time battles of previous titles. Nonetheless, the game shines in its rich storytelling and character development, offering an immersive world that captures the essence of the Forgotten Realms. Visually, it impresses with detailed environments and character models. In sum, Baldur's Gate 3 delivers a compelling experience, but the shift in combat style may leave players divided based on their personal preferences.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It has been said before by many Gaming Outlets - this game is an absolute anomaly! It can't be judged through some quick test session and a couple of combat trials. The game is complicated - especially to those who are not familiar with DnD mechanics - and you're required to really take your time with it. Otherwise you might still find it good, but you wouldn't even begin to understand the scale of its greatness. Visually stunning, great Performance on PS5, insane (!) gameplay options and one of the most immersive gaming experiences i've ever had. I get that it might not be for everyone, but to say this game is trash or rate it with 0/10 speaks more about the reviewer than about the game. Baldurs Gate 3 is an absolute game changer!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/xYourDeus/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="xYourDeus">
    xYourDeus
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I love this game. Already clocked in at 24 hours of play time, been playing early access because I preordered the game and been having a blast all around.

I love it when RPGs give you complete agency over everything, and it seems to have no limitations on what you can or can't do, the dialogue options are fun, the characters are interesting to talk to with their own motives and ambitions, the setting is fun. This game has very few weaknesses.

The only downside one might see is turn-based combat, but I honestly think it was done pretty well here. The sheer number of skills and perks you get for characters allows you tons of ways to make the combat fun. It's even to a point where you can give your characters the ability to attack multiple times per turn and decimate enemy camps with high dps. The RPG aspects is what initially got me  playing this game but the combat is so much fun that I can't put the game down.

The game also gives you tons of game options to customize the game to make things even more difficult if you want it to be. I really like the karmic dice option which allows you to go classic DND ruleset using the dice more often which can make combat and dialogues even more complex than it is.

The sheer amount of ways to have fun and keep you engaged and coming back to this game is why I think Baldur's Gate 3 is a masterpiece.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    WEREWOLF07
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is tough to write because honestly, Act 1 and 2 make this game THE Game of the Year. Heck, I was ready to put it in my top 5 all time favorite games. I have 100+ hours in this game now and just loved the story and choices and the combat.

And then Act 3 happened. I started having performance issues, I started having weird glitches were my companions would lose half their bodies and couldn't fight anymore, I've had 5 different quests completely bug out on me and even a main quest bug out that I can't even complete. Not only that, but the story choices of what is going on - the main bad guys and fights aren't as thought out as things were in the first 2 acts. It is very clear that Act 3 was completely rushed in my opinion to get the release out the door and does not have the same care that Acts 1 and 2 had.

All of that enjoyment of Acts 1 and 2 to just come up against the frustrations in Act 3 killed my enthusiasm for this game. I know Larian will likely fix these issues as I suspect as more people start finishing the game they will see/hear this criticism - and quite possibly they already know this. But I can't in good faith recommend someone spend 80+ hours in a game and then just run up against game breaking bugs that won't allow them to finish the game they way they want to. That just feels pretty bad.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      PlayStation 5
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Jt0429/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Jt0429">
    Jt0429
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Good-
Places extreme emphasis on player choice and agency; Extremely reactive world and story that take all choices into account; Actual consequences give weight to all your actions; Incredible storytelling and writing; Excellent cast of characters; Nuanced, complex combat system that rewards you more the more time you invest into it; Impressive production values, from cutscenes to animations for even the most insignificant NPCs; Neat, easy-to-use console UI and controls.

Bad-
Some minor technical issues.

Thoughts-
Minor issues aside, it’s hard not to be blown away by the scope of Baldur’s Gate 3’s achievements. For player freedom, for DnD simulation, for choice-based storytelling, for writing, and for a multitude of other things, it’s very much become the new gold standard. I’ve been enraptured by every single minute I’ve spent in the densely packed world of Baldur’s Gate 3, and I’m going to be spending many, many more hours here before I’ve had my fill.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
